snippet: Warren E. Buffett, the company’s chairman, and Charlie Munger, the vice chairman, will field shareholder questions at the company’s annual meeting on Saturday.
abstract: Berkshire Hathaway reports that profits soared 51 percent in first quarter, helped by improved results in insurance and gains from investments and derivative contracts; net income increased to $4.89 billion, or $2,977 per Class A share, from $3.25 billion, or $1,966 a share; revenue rose 15 percent from year ago to $43.87 billion.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett, the company’s chairman, and Charlie Munger, the vice chairman, will field shareholder questions at the company’s annual meeting on Saturday.

headline.main: Insurance Gains Help Push Profit at Berkshire Hathaway Up Nearly 51 %
headline.print_headline: Insurance Gains Help Push Profit at Berkshire Hathaway Up Nearly 51%
